channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Singapore’s ComfortDelGro will bid for Melbourne’s rail line as it takes its public transport model global
item.description: “Ten to 14 years ago we were not even in the position to bid for this contract,” ComforDelGro CEO Cheng Siak Kian said in an interview with Fortune.

item.title: Trump says he's 'not happy' with Putin after massive Ukraine strike
item.description: President Trump criticized Putin's deadly missile strikes on Ukraine on Sunday, saying that he had "always gotten along with him" but that he condemns...

item.title: US stock futures gain as Trump delays EU tariffs
item.description: To Capital Economics, Trump’s threat of a 50% tariff on the EU from June may well turn out to be a “negotiating tactic” and seems “very unlikely” to b...

item.title: Trump agrees to delay 50% tariff on EU goods by more than a month
item.description: President Trump has delayed the 50% tariff he recently vowed to impose on European goods.

item.title: Homeland Security chief Noem visits Netanyahu ahead of Jerusalem Day
item.description: Kristi Noem's meeting with Netanyahu in Jerusalem highlights U.S.-Israel strengthens ties amid embassy attack and Netanyahu's firm stance against Hama...

item.title: Trump extends deadline for 50% tariffs on EU to July 9
item.description: Trump on Friday threatened to impose a 50% tariff on the EU after complaining the bloc was slow-walking negotiations.

item.title: Is Catholicism ‘Cool’ Now?
item.description: It isn’t just the ritual and the pageantry and the history that are bringing in the crowds.

item.title: Trump officials say judge blocking murderers' deportations ruining U.S. foreign policy talks
item.description: The Trump administration for months has obliquely warned judges their immigration rulings were messing with touchy foreign policy negotiations.

item.title: Big Government and Lobbyists Are Crushing the Dream of Home Ownership
item.description: If we don’t address the problem, the home-buying hopes of the next generation will be crushed.

item.title: Johnson accuses Democrats of 'twisted the facts' on Medicaid changes

item.title: Five Years After The Fires, The Myth Of George Floyd Remains
item.description: The convict with the long rap sheet became a patron saint for a leftist movement preaching chaos in an election-year power grab.

item.title: Here’s how the Supreme Court could weaken American exceptionalism in financial markets

item.title: Jerome Powell tells Princeton grads not to take universities for granted and that ‘integrity is all we have—guard it carefully’
item.description: "Our great universities are the envy of the world and a crucial national asset," Powell said.

item.title: Sympathy for the Unpublished Young White Male Author
item.description: Are people allowed to observe that the literary world is deliberately sidelining a certain demographic of writer — and to do something about it?

item.title: Why the Media Keep Getting It Wrong
item.description: The failure to adequately cover Biden’s decline points to a broader breakdown that has a simple explanation.

item.title: Speaker Johnson clashes with Rand Paul over 'wimpy' spending cuts in Trump's bill
item.description: Debate over the "big, beautiful bill" intensifies as Speaker Mike Johnson and Sen. Rand Paul discuss spending cuts and debt ceiling on Sunday.

item.title: The Upside of Gerontocracy
item.description: There are advantages older figures can bring to politics — even if the current generation has ruined the reputation of elder statesmen.

item.title: Sen. Michael Bennet blames Democratic Party's failures for fueling President Trump's rise

item.title: ‘Dementia Watch’: Brian Stelter More Upset By Trump’s Vanishing Transcripts Than Biden’s Vacant Presidency
item.description: Brian Stelter wouldn't recognize transparency if it bit him in the rump.

item.title: Supreme Court Stands By While Lower Courts Carry On Ripping Up The Constitution
item.description: Until the Supreme Court acts, an unconstitutional supremacy will continue to infect even the furthest limbs of the judicial branch.

item.title: The Downgrade Is Done. The Investor Response Is Just Beginning
item.description: The US downgrade won’t upend markets—but it may reshape sovereign risk models and investor assumptions. Here’s what to watch next.

item.title: Tariffs and Returns: Lessons from 150 Years of Market History
item.description: What 150 years of market data reveal about tariffs, growth, and investment returns—and how equity factors have historically delivered resilience.

item.title: AI Bias by Design: What the Claude Prompt Leak Reveals for Investment Professionals
item.description: A leaked AI system prompt reveals hidden biases in Claude's outputs. What every investment professional should know about using LLMs effectively.
